column2: schematic; designed to be easy to learn
column3: naturalistic; designed to be easy to understand to as many people as possible
letters c, h, g, q, t, and w are variable
primary control languages: English, French, Italian, Spanish and Portuguese
dis- for verbs and words derived from verbs, in- for adjectives and words derived from adjectives in addition, certain roots can be prefixed, e.g. mal

column1: Patro Nia, kiu estas en la ?ielo,
column2: Patre nostre, qui es in le celos,
column3: Patre nostre, qui es in celos,
column4: Pater noster, qui es in cælis,
column5: Our Father, who art in heaven,

column1: kiel en la ?ielo, tiel anka? sur la tero.
column2: como in le celo, etiam super le terra.
column3: como in celo, e in terra.
column4: sicut in cælo, et in terra.
column5: on earth, as it is in heaven.

column1: Nian panon ?iutagan donu al ni hodia?.

column4: Panem nostrum quotidianum da nobis hodie,

column2: e pardona a nos nostre debitas

column1: Kaj ne konduku nin en tenton,
